start.speaker: Lord Harlan
start.text: [He barely glances at you] Yes? What is it? I'm quite busy.

choices.text: My lord, I'm investigating the chapel theft. May I ask you some questions?
Apologies for disturbing you, my lord. I'll return later.
I need to speak with you. It's about a crime.

investigation_request.speaker: Lord Harlan
investigation_request.text: The candlesticks? And they sent an initiate to question a lord? [He sighs] Very well. Ask your questions. But be quick — time spent with you is time wasted.

choices.text: Were you in the chapel the night of the theft?
Your page was seen near the chapel that night.
Thank you for your time, my lord.

alibi_question.speaker: Lord Harlan
alibi_question.text: I was in my chambers, entertaining guests. Lord Vance and Lady Merideth can confirm, if you dare question them as well. Is that sufficient, or do you need a sworn statement?

choices.text: That's sufficient. Thank you, my lord.
Your page was seen there. Where was he?

page_accusation.speaker: Lord Harlan
page_accusation.text: [His eyes narrow] Are you accusing my household of theft? Choose your next words very carefully, initiate.

choices.text: I'm not accusing anyone. I'm gathering information.
I go where the evidence leads, my lord.

page_question.speaker: Lord Harlan
page_question.text: Thomin? He runs errands for me. Perhaps I sent him to light a candle for my late father. Is prayer now a crime?

backpedal.speaker: Lord Harlan
backpedal.text: See that you continue to do so. Carefully. [He returns to his papers] We're done here.

bold_response.speaker: Lord Harlan
bold_response.text: Evidence. [A cold smile] Then find some. Real evidence. And when you don't, we'll discuss the consequences of wasting my time.

polite_exit.speaker: Lord Harlan
polite_exit.text: [He waves dismissively] Yes, yes. Close the door on your way out.

direct_approach.speaker: Lord Harlan
direct_approach.text: A crime. How dramatic. [He leans back] I assume you mean the chapel theft everyone's whispering about. What of it?

greeting_hostile.speaker: Lord Harlan
greeting_hostile.text: You again. I thought I made myself clear — I have no interest in speaking with you.

choices.text: My apologies, my lord. I'll leave.
This is important, my lord, whether you wish to speak or not.

hostile_insist.speaker: Lord Harlan
hostile_insist.text: Your persistence borders on insolence. Speak quickly, then get out of my sight.
